item.title: Complex Procedural Rust Macros
item.description: In this post, we write a procedural macro that generates code to bind functions and types including arbitrary many impl blocks to a scripting language. The problems encountered and techniques learned can be applied to other tasks where complex compile-time analysis that spans multiple macro invocations is required.

item.title: Why not to use prod data for testing - and what to do instead
item.guid: Why not to use prod data for testing - and what to do instead
item.description: Some thoughts on why using prod data for testing is still commonplace and why it is time to change this.

item.title: How to Create PostgreSQL Test Data
item.guid: How to Create PostgreSQL Test Data
item.description: This post covers three different ways to generate test data for your Postgres database

item.title: Create realistic test data for your web app
item.guid: Create realistic test data for your web app
item.description: In this post we're going to explore how we can solve the problem of test data generation using our open-source project, Synth! Synth is a state-of-the-art declarative data generator - you tell Synth what you want your data to look like and Synth will generate that data for you.
